question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Thread safety] If multiple threads access PublicParameters concurrently during DKG, can race conditions in reading enc or g_2 fields lead to inconsistent views of the parameters? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: get_commitment_base()] [Concurrent reads] Does get_commitment_base() provide thread-safe access to g_2, or can concurrent mutations from unsafe code cause data races? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: get_encryption_public_params()] [Borrow checker bypass] Can unsafe code or interior mutability bypass Rust's borrow checker to mutate the returned reference to enc, corrupting the public parameters? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: default()] [Parameter consistency] If different validator nodes call Default at different times or with different code versions, can they end up with incompatible public parameters that break DKG consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Seed manipulation] In a live DKG ceremony, if Byzantine validators can influence the seed parameter, can they bias the resulting public parameters to gain advantage in secret reconstruction? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: with_max_num_shares()] [DKG scaling] Does ignoring the n parameter in with_max_num_shares() create issues when DKG ceremonies scale to thousands of validators, potentially causing memory exhaustion or performance degradation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: default_with_bls_base()] [Key reuse across epochs] If the same BLS keys are reused across multiple DKG epochs, can this create cross-epoch attacks where information from one epoch helps attack another? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Endianness] Does the serialization format specify byte order, or can big-endian vs little-endian confusion cause parameters to deserialize incorrectly on different platforms? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Version compatibility] If the encryption_elgamal::g1::PUBLIC_PARAMS_NUM_BYTES constant changes in future versions, will old serialized parameters still deserialize correctly or cause breaking errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Padding bytes] Are there any padding bytes in the serialization format that could be exploited to hide malicious data or create non-canonical representations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Deserialization order] Does deserializing enc_pp before g_2 create any security dependencies or race conditions if partial deserialization state is observable? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Hash function security] Does hash_to_curve rely on SHA-256 or SHA-3 for hashing, and could weaknesses in the hash function compromise the randomness of derived group elements? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Discrete log hardness] Are all generated group elements provably in the prime-order subgroup where discrete log is hard, or could they be in small subgroups enabling efficient discrete log attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: default_with_bls_base()] [Generator security] Is the G1Projective::generator() a secure nothing-up-my-sleeve generator, or could it have been maliciously chosen to have weak discrete log properties? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [DDH assumption] Does the PVSS scheme rely on the Decisional Diffie-Hellman (DDH) assumption over G1, and could weak public parameters break this assumption enabling decryption attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Message base security] Is the h element used as message base in ElGamal properly independent of g, or can known relationships between them enable chosen-ciphertext attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: default_with_bls_base()] [Pubkey base reuse] Does reusing BLS signature public keys as ElGamal encryption pubkey base create malleability issues where signature operations can be replayed as encryption operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [ElGamal IND-CPA] Are the ElGamal public parameters sufficient to provide IND-CPA security, or do weak parameters enable an adversary to distinguish encryptions of different messages? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Randomness reuse] If the same public parameters are used across multiple PVSS transcripts, can randomness reuse in ElGamal encryption leak information about dealt secrets? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: get_commitment_base()] [Commitment binding] Is the g_2 base sufficient to provide binding commitments, or could an adversary find multiple different polynomials that produce the same commitment? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: get_commitment_base()] [Commitment hiding] Does using G2 for commitments while G1 is used for encryption create information leakage between the commitment and encryption layers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [G2 selection] Is the g_2 element in G2 selected independently enough from g and h in G1 to prevent pairing-based attacks that relate commitments to encryptions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: default_with_bls_base()] [Commitment base collision] Could the g_2_with_bls_base label collide with other commitment schemes in Aptos, causing commitment forgery across different protocols? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Seed length] Is there any validation on the seed parameter length, or can zero-length or excessively long seeds cause hash_to_curve to behave unexpectedly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Seed content] Can null bytes, non-UTF8 sequences, or other special characters in the seed cause hash_to_curve to produce weak or predictable group elements? (Medium)
